cards.name: Kill Shot
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor: Mardu archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They never miss their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Pariah
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
cards.flavor: "It is not sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

rulings.text: You can attach this to an opponent's creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Reviving Dose
cards.text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.
cards.originalText:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Spirit of the Hearth
cards.text:
Flying
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: Thieves know that a snarl in the night means, "Rob another house."
cards.originalText:
Flying
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Farmers typically keep their flocks at thirteen sheep—one to distract the griffins while they take the other twelve to market.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Windborne Charge
cards.text: Two target creatures you control each get +2/+2 and gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The merfolk call the sky goddess Emeria. The kor call her Kamsa. The two races agree on little except that she offers many blessings to the faithful.

rulings.text: You must target two creatures you control as you cast Windborne Charge. If you can't (because you control just one creature, perhaps), you can't cast the spell.

cards.originalText: Two target creatures you control each get +2/+2 and gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Zealous Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Bonds of Quicksilver
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor: The sea's reach extends beyond its shores.

rulings.text: Bonds of Quicksilver may target and may enchant an untapped creature.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Caller of Gales
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Some merfolk choose to rest their fins in the water. I believe wisdom exists not only where we were born but where we were told not to go."
cards.originalText: {1}{U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Cloaked Siren
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
cards.flavor:
"That is not the voice of the wind singing on the stones."
—Callaphe the mariner
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

cards.name: Covenant of Minds
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may choose to put those cards into your hand. If they don't, put those cards into your graveyard and draw five cards.
cards.flavor: Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.

rulings.text: The targeted opponent has two options: Let you have the three revealed cards or let you have five unknown cards. Note that if the opponent goes with the first option, you put cards into your hand rather than draw them (in case something like Hoofprints of the Stag cares about that), but if the opponent goes with the second option, you actually draw cards.

cards.originalText: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may choose to put those cards into your hand. If he or she doesn't, put those cards into your graveyard and draw five cards.

cards.name: Deceiver Exarch
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.

cards.name: Desertion
cards.text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.

rulings.text: The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Dismiss
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Fleeting Distraction
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The first spell taught to young mages, it has spared the lives of many whose hands are too small to hold a sword.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Fleeting Distraction resolves, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Fleeting Distraction tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Followed Footsteps
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Æther can turn a footprint into a blueprint.

rulings.text: Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature trigger when the creature tokens enter the battlefield. The creature tokens also have any "this enters the battlefield with" or "as this enters the battlefield" abilities that the copied creature has.
If Followed Footsteps moves after it has triggered, you get a copy of the newly-enchanted creature.

If Followed Footsteps and the enchanted creature leave the battlefield simultaneously (say via Upheaval or Akroma's Vengence somehow cast in response to the triggered ability), then a token copy of the creature that was enchanted when it was last on the battlefield is created. If Followed Foosteps did not enchant a creature when last on the battlefield as it went to the graveyard as a state-based action when the enchanted creature left the battlefield in response to the trigger, then no copy will get created.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a token that's a copy of enchanted creature onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Into the Void
cards.text: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"The cathars have their swords, the inquisitors their axes. I prefer the 'diplomatic' approach."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau
cards.originalText: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

rulings.text: The additional draw triggers just after the normal draw for the turn happens.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの物あさり

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Merfolk Skyscout
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Merfolk Skyscout attacks or blocks, untap target permanent.
cards.flavor: "Emeria is a pleasant lie, a figment to hide Emrakul's hideous face. I can only hope to uncover a truth that lies deeper still."

rulings.text: When Merfolk Skyscout blocks, its second ability triggers just once, even if it somehow blocked multiple attacking creatures.
You may target any permanent with the ability, including Merfolk Skyscout itself or a permanent that's already untapped.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの空偵者

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Merfolk Skyscout attacks or blocks, untap target permanent.

cards.name: Mnemonic Wall
cards.text:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"I'd build an entire fortress of them if I could."
—Mzali, Lighthouse archmage
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor:
"You cannot be an Ojutai monk. They prize wisdom and skill, and you have neither."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Repulse
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "You aren't invited."
cards.originalText:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Serum Visions
cards.text: Draw a card. Scry 2.
cards.originalText: Draw a card. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Show and Tell
cards.text: Each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."

rulings.text: If the cards being put onto the battlefield also require choices, those choices are made after all players choose their card. The active player makes choices for their card (if any), then the other players (if any) in turn order.
Players choose cards during resolution, not announcement.

The current player chooses first, then each other player chooses in turn order. A player does not have to reveal the chosen card, so long as it is clear *which* card was chosen. After all choices are made, the cards are put onto the battlefield simultaneously.

cards.originalText: Each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Sphinx of Magosi
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Draw a card, then put a +1/+1 counter on Sphinx of Magosi.
cards.flavor: "A riddle is nothing more than a trap for small minds, baited with the promise of understanding."

foreignNames.name: マゴーシのスフィンクス

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{U}: Draw a card, then put a +1/+1 counter on Sphinx of Magosi.

cards.name: Traumatic Visions
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Basic landcycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell.
Basic landcycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Vaporkin
cards.text:
Flying
Vaporkin can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Mists are carefree. They drift where they will, unencumbered by rocks and river beds."
—Thrasios, triton hero
cards.originalText:
Flying
Vaporkin can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Vertigo Spawn
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Vertigo Spawn blocks a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: If the creature was already tapped when Vertigo Spawn blocked it, that creature still won't untap during its controller's next untap step.

If two Vertigo Spawns block the same creature, both abilities trigger, but each only affects the creature during its controller's next untap step. The creature can untap during its controller's untap step following that one.

cards.originalText:
Defender
Whenever Vertigo Spawn blocks a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Absorb Vis
cards.text:
Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, your death will be as informative as possible."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Avatar of Woe
cards.text:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {B}{B} to cast it.

cards.originalText:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Blood-Toll Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
When Blood-Toll Harpy enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: When harpies demand a toll to cross through their territory, consider yourself lucky if they permit payment in coin.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Blood-Toll Harpy enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.
cards.originalText: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Death Wind
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Driver of the Dead
cards.text: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.

rulings.text: If Driver of the Dead dies at the same time as a creature with converted mana cost 2 or less, you can target that card and return it to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Farbog Boneflinger
cards.text: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"
—Gisa, to Geralf

rulings.text: Farbog Boneflinger's ability is mandatory. If it's the only creature on the battlefield, you must choose it as the target and give it -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.originalText: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Festergloom
cards.text: Nonblack creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The death of a scout can be as informative as a safe return.
cards.originalText: Nonblack creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fleshbag Marauder
cards.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

As Fleshbag Marauder's ability resolves, first you choose a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all those creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.

cards.originalText: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Guul Draz Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Guul Draz Specter gets +3/+3 as long as an opponent has no cards in hand.
Whenever Guul Draz Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

foreignNames.name: グール・ドラズの死霊

cards.originalText:
Flying
Guul Draz Specter gets +3/+3 as long as an opponent has no cards in hand.
Whenever Guul Draz Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Harvester of Souls
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud
cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Infest
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This is why we don't go out in banewasp weather."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout
cards.originalText: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Inquisition of Kozilek
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: You will scream out your innermost secrets just to make it stop.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Keepsake Gorgon
cards.text:
Deathtouch
{5}{B}{B}: Monstrosity 1. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Keepsake Gorgon becomes monstrous, destroy target non-Gorgon creature an opponent controls.

rulings.text: Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
{5}{B}{B}: Monstrosity 1. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Keepsake Gorgon becomes monstrous, destroy target non-Gorgon creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Mausoleum Turnkey
cards.text: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.
cards.originalText: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: A spark of resistance against a tide of corruption.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの闘技場

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Public Execution
cards.text: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.

rulings.text: Only creatures controlled by the player when Public Execution resolves will get -2/-0. Creatures that enter the battlefield under that player's control or that the player gains control of later in the turn are unaffected.

Public Execution targets only the creature it destroys. If that creature is an illegal target when Public Execution tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No creature will get -2/-0.
If the target creature regenerates or has indestructible, each other creature controlled by that creature's controller will still get -2/-0.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sangromancer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

rulings.text: If one or more creatures an opponent controls are put into the graveyard at the same time as Sangromancer, Sangromancer's first ability will trigger that many times.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

cards.name: Shambling Goblin
cards.text: When Shambling Goblin dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Kolaghan send them at us. We kill and raise them. They fight the next wave the Kolaghan send. It's a neat little cycle."
—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer
cards.originalText: When Shambling Goblin dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stromkirk Patrol
cards.text: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: "You'd best move along, human. Our palates are far less discerning than our master's."
cards.originalText: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Unnerve
cards.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

rulings.text: Players with less than 2 cards discard all they have.

cards.originalText: Each opponent discards two cards.

cards.name: Burn Away
cards.text: Burn Away deals 6 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, exile all cards from its controller's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Your corruption will burn, serpent, until there is nothing left to defile."
—Asmala, bloodfire mystic

rulings.text: If the creature doesn't die that turn, the delayed triggered ability will simply cease to exist. It won't trigger on a future turn.

cards.originalText: Burn Away deals 6 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, exile all cards from its controller's graveyard.

cards.name: Burning Wish
cards.text: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.
cards.flavor: She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.originalText: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.

cards.name: Charmbreaker Devils
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The instant or sorcery card returned to your hand is chosen at random as Charmbreaker Devils's first ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned.
Because the first ability doesn't target the instant or sorcery card, any instants or sorceries put into your graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.
All players get to see which card you chose at random as it's returned to your hand.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Coordinated Assault
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It's hard to shout "Shields up!" with a javelin in your chest.
cards.originalText: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Ember Beast
cards.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.

rulings.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block unless another creature is also assigned to attack or block at the same time. Notably, two Ember Beasts can attack or block together.
Once Ember Beast has been declared as an attacker or blocker, it doesn't matter what happens to the other creature(s).

Other creatures assigned to attack alongside Ember Beast don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. Other creatures assigned to block alongside Ember Beast don't have to block the same creature as Ember Beast.

cards.originalText: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Fiery Fall
cards.text:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Flame Slash
cards.text: Flame Slash deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: After millennia asleep, the Eldrazi had forgotten about Zendikar's fiery temper and dislike of strangers.
cards.originalText: Flame Slash deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Gang of Devils
cards.text: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor:
"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"
—Gregel, township militia

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you put Gang of Devils's triggered ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. (In other words, as you put the ability on the stack, you choose whether to have it deal 3 damage to a single target, 2 damage to one target and 1 damage to another target, or 1 damage to each of three targets.)

cards.originalText: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The enemy is getting too close! Quick! Inflate the toad!"

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade's ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.originalText: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Tunneler
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "The best way over the mountain is through."

rulings.text: The power of the targeted creature is checked both as you target it and as the ability resolves. After the ability resolves, the creature can't be blocked that turn even if its power becomes greater than 2.

The ability doesn't grant an ability to the targeted creature. Rather, it affects the game rules and states something that's now true about that creature. After the ability resolves, the creature can't be blocked that turn even if it loses all abilities.

foreignNames.name: ゴブリンのトンネル掘り

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Gratuitous Violence
cards.text: If a creature you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: Only the Cabal could make a fight to the death more deadly.
cards.originalText: If a creature you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: He wants to watch Ravnica burn, one soul at a time.

rulings.text: Guttersnipe's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Guttersnipe's ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Hamletback Goliath
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.
cards.flavor:
"If you live on a giant's back, there's only one individual you'll ever need to fear."
—Gaddock Teeg

rulings.text: The value of X is determined as the ability begins resolving. If the other creature is no longer on the battlefield, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.

cards.name: Havengul Vampire
cards.text:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.

foreignNames.name: ヘイヴングルの吸血鬼

cards.originalText:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.

cards.name: Hurly-Burly
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
• Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Ill-Tempered Cyclops
cards.text:
Trample
{5}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
cards.flavor: A cyclops has two moods: angry and asleep.

rulings.text: Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

foreignNames.name: 不機嫌なサイクロプス

cards.originalText:
Trample
{5}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.name: Kiln Fiend
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.

rulings.text: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend's ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ogre Sentry
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavor:
"You have to appreciate the genius of it. Why bother building defenses when you can just fill the pass with angry ogres?"
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter
cards.originalText: Defender

cards.name: Stoneshock Giant
cards.text:
{6}{R}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Stoneshock Giant becomes monstrous, creatures without flying your opponents control can't block this turn.

rulings.text: If blockers have already been declared when Stoneshock Giant's last ability resolves, those blocks won't change or become undone.

Your opponents can't assign any creature without flying to block that turn, even if that creature had flying or wasn't on the battlefield under one of your opponent's control when Stoneshock Giant's ability resolved.
Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
{6}{R}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Stoneshock Giant becomes monstrous, creatures without flying your opponents control can't block this turn.

cards.name: Sulfurous Blast
cards.text: Sulfurous Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player. If you cast this spell during your main phase, Sulfurous Blast deals 3 damage to each creature and each player instead.
cards.flavor: The Keldons used the toxic vents in the cracked earth to bolster their home's defenses.
cards.originalText: Sulfurous Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player. If you cast this spell during your main phase, Sulfurous Blast deals 3 damage to each creature and each player instead.

cards.name: Tormenting Voice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol

rulings.text: You must discard exactly one card to cast Tormenting Voice; you can't cast it without discarding a card, and you can't discard additional cards.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Tormenting Voice, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Do you hear that, Sarkhan? The glory of the horde! I made a legend from what you abandoned."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Twin Bolt
cards.text: Twin Bolt deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.
cards.flavor: Kolaghan archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They utilize their dragonlord's lightning to strike their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.

rulings.text: You choose whether Twin Bolt has one target that will be dealt 2 damage or two targets that will each be dealt 1 damage as you cast Twin Bolt.

If you cast Twin Bolt with two targets and one of those targets becomes illegal before Twin Bolt resolves, the remaining legal target will be dealt 1 damage. You can't change the original division of damage.

cards.originalText: Twin Bolt deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Beast Within
cards.text: Destroy target permanent. Its controller creates a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Monsters dwell in every heart. We only think civilization tames them."
—Euphemia, Nexus watcher

rulings.text: If the permanent is an illegal target when Beast Within tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The permanent's controller won't get a Beast token.
If the permanent is still a legal target but is not destroyed (perhaps because it regenerated or has indestructible), its controller still gets the Beast token.

cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent. Its controller puts a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Berserk
cards.text:
Cast this spell only before the combat damage step.
Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.

rulings.text: If the permanent stops being a creature before the end of the turn, it is still destroyed.

cards.originalText:
Cast Berserk only before the combat damage step.
Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"The gods used their feathers to paint all the colors of the world."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur Forest
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Brushstrider
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Magistrate Ludy agreed to designate land for the brushstriders only after several broken windows and dozens of missing blini-cakes.
cards.originalText: Vigilance

cards.name: Burgeoning
cards.text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The first vine shows the others where to grow.

rulings.text: Playing a land will trigger it, but putting a land onto the battlefield as part of an effect will not.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a land, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Copperhorn Scout
cards.text: Whenever Copperhorn Scout attacks, untap each other creature you control.
cards.flavor: Fangren spur may sound louder, but Viridian resurgents claim that the horn of the vorrac creates a truer, more inspiring note.

rulings.text: As Copperhorn Scout's ability resolves, you'll untap each other creature you control regardless of whether that creature was attacking.
Untapping an attacking creature doesn't cause it to stop attacking.

cards.originalText: Whenever Copperhorn Scout attacks, untap each other creature you control.

cards.name: Explosive Vegetation
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fade into Antiquity
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Are the gods angry at our discontent with what they give us, or jealous that we made a thing they cannot?"
—Kleon the Iron-Booted
cards.originalText: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Forgotten Ancient
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

rulings.text: It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

cards.name: Irresistible Prey
cards.text:
Target creature must be blocked this turn if able.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The baloth's instincts boiled, its muscles pulled taut, and its razor-spines bristled, as it turned to face—a runt meepling.

rulings.text: You can target a creature you don't control or that otherwise couldn't attack that turn.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Irresistible Prey resolves, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.
The creature affected by Irresistible Prey doesn't have to attack that turn.
If the affected creature attacks, the defending player must assign at least one blocker to it during the declare blockers step, unless that player controls no creatures that could block it.

cards.originalText:
Target creature must be blocked this turn if able.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Lace with Moonglove
cards.text:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Which is more filled with poison: the flower of the moonglove or the minds of elves?"
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

rulings.text: Deathtouch applies when any damage is dealt, not just when combat damage is dealt.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Lay of the Land
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Victory favors neither the righteous nor the wicked. It favors the prepared.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Manaplasm
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.

rulings.text: Converted mana cost takes into account only the mana symbols printed in the upper right corner of the card. Manaplasm doesn't care about additional costs, alternative costs, cost-reduction effects, or what you actually paid to cast the spell.

While a spell with {X} in its cost is on the stack, its converted mana cost takes the chosen value of X into account. For example, if you cast Blaze (a spell with the mana cost {X}{R}) and choose a value of 5 for that X, then your Manaplasm will get +6/+6 until end of turn.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Nessian Asp
cards.text:
Reach
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
cards.flavor: It's not the two heads you should fear. It's the four fangs.

rulings.text: Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Reach
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.name: Netcaster Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Netcaster Spider blocks a creature with flying, Netcaster Spider gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is an expert at culling individuals who stray too far from the herd.
cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Netcaster Spider blocks a creature with flying, Netcaster Spider gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nature doesn't walk.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The elf's blade carved deep into the Eldrazi drone's fleshy lattices. Without a sound, the drone lost equilibrium and tumbled from the sky.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

rulings.text: If either or both targets are illegal when Prey Upon tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Ravenous Leucrocota
cards.text:
Vigilance
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
cards.flavor: Hunger makes a leucrocota dangerous. A full belly makes it angry and dangerous.

rulings.text: Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

foreignNames.name: 貪欲なるレウクロッタ

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.name: Strength in Numbers
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and gets +X/+X, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The hermit dies. The outcast dies. The lone wolf dies. Only those who stick together survive this world."
—Uros, Pendelhaven elder

rulings.text: The value of X is determined only as Strength in Numbers resolves. It won't change later in the turn if the number of attacking creatures changes.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and gets +X/+X, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
